text: Sir Thomas Esmonde, 9th Baronet (10 December 1786 – 31 December 1868) was an Irish Whig politician. Esmonde was son of Dr. John EsmondeDr. John Esmonde Dictionary of Irish Biography and Helen née O'Callan. He first married Mary Payne, daughter of E. Payne in 1812, and after her death in 1840, remarried to Sophia Maria Rowe, daughter of Ebenezer Radford Rowe, in 1856. Neither wife bore his children. He was elected Whig MP for at the 1841 general election and held the seat until 1847 when he did not seek re-election. He succeeded to the Baronetcy of Ballynastragh in 1803 upon the death of Sir Thomas Esmonde, 8th Baronet. Upon his own death in 1868, the title was inherited by Sir John Esmonde, 10th Baronet. He was a member of the Reform Club and was, at some point, appointed a Privy Counsellor. ==References== ==External links== * Category:UK MPs 1841–1847 Category:Whig (British political party) MPs for Irish constituencies Category:Baronets in the Baronetage of the United Kingdom Category:1786 births Category:1868 deaths Category:Members of the Privy Council of the United Kingdom Category:Esmonde family
title: Sir Thomas Esmonde, 9th Baronet
